alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trujillo. - This includes the following highways... State Road 104 between Mile Markers 12 and 36. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 362 and 365...and near Mile Marker 366. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
